intro: Glossonema arabicum, commonly known as the Arabian horned grass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically wind-pollinated, a common trait among grasses. Glossonema arabicum is adapted to harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that allow it to survive in poor soil conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat.
